website_summaries.verdict: A unique approach to comfort and support while flying. Flexible neck brace design makes it convenient to wear in tight spaces like packed airplanes.
pros: The wrap comfortably surrounds and supports the neck and head
Easy to put on to use for long periods of sleep
cons: Doesn't provide direct head support like more traditional travel pillows

customer_reviews.title: One amazing the other horrible
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 2 of these this year and the products were completely different. One amazing the other horrible. Double check they sent you the correct item! The one on the right actually works... the one on the left is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bate and switch? WATCH OUT
customer_reviews.text: I received what I must assume is an older model of this product, which was not what was pictured on the product page. The images clearly showed a more sophisticated support structure, but I got the one which other reviews mentioned doesn't work at all. What a disappointment. Trying to get rid of old products to unsuspecting buyers? I'm not sure, but I read another person's review claiming the same switch. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: (video test & demo) So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: ✏️ Quick thoughts to supplement my video demonstration. - I'm a tall guy who can't EVER sleep on planes. If anything, this is the travel pillow to try. - It does actually support my head. I was surprised. - Soft material is delightful. - Much better than those blow-up kind or those little foam bead kinds. I can't stand those, and they instantly give me a sore neck. 📍 Bottom line: would I recommend this product to one of my friends? 👍 Yes, totally.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Chevassus

customer_reviews.title: better than the standard U-shaped pillow, but it wasn't amazing
customer_reviews.text: Works as indicated, but not nearly as comfortable as the other reviews said. I travel from the US to NZ several times a year and was looking forward to trying this out... It was better than the standard U-shaped pillow, but it wasn't amazing. The plastic bits got a bit hard and constraining. The U-shaped pillows give you a bit more freedom and aren't as restricting.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A.

customer_reviews.title: The thing is virtually useless. It would be nice if they've spent more ...
customer_reviews.text: The thing is virtually useless. It would be nice if they've spent more than ~$3 producing it. the part that wraps around your neck doesn't have any reinforcement what so ever. That causes it to shrink into a fine rope that bites into your neck causing huge discomfort. The fact that the attachment is present only in the center only helps that process. It is an easy fix: add support "ribs" to the wrapping part and add top and bottom attachments, but that would increase manufacture cost by 5% and they cannot afford to make that investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mikler

customer_reviews.title: The quality is downgraded.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one last month and used for an international travel. It worked perfectly. Then I gave that one to my husband and with no hesitation bought this one at raised price. Now I am using it for an another international travel, but it seems not working because the quality is different. The new one just does not support the neck properly. So I gave it 1 star rate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael X.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my flight to Israel, and I slept well in a crowded coach middle seat. Slept in terminal during layover too. Very comfortable and soothing-much better than traditional travel pillows and very lightweight. Fit easily within the carry loop on the outside of my backpack when not in use. I treasure this new travel aid! Highly recommended! Did not interfere with my over ear headphones either! The pillow rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Cron

customer_reviews.title: Better sleep on trips & saves from trips to chiropractor
customer_reviews.text: Pictures don’t die it justice! I love this product. When I “lost” this product at my ex’s, had to immediately get another. It is soft yet strong and structured where it needs to be to hold up my head and support my neck so I don’t end up with neck/shoulder pain from traveling. Not just for use on planes, but also great to have on a long car ride. Ignore how it might make you look! Worth every penny because I don’t have to go to the chiropractor after every trip anymore. Have been able to sleep better as well on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Christina N

customer_reviews.title: If it wasn't free, I'd be returning it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for free in exchange for an honest review. And I'm honestly surprised why it's rated so high. I could never get this thing positioned remotely comfortably. It was either digging into my chin, neck, or shoulder. I could constantly feel the spines through the fleece material. There was no way I was sleeping with this thing. I spent most of my flight with it propped up backwards against the window or the back of my seat, which only gave me moderate support, although this was clearly not it's intended positioning. But, better than nothing. Two stars because I was able to use it somewhat, and it was free.
customer_reviews.author: Crystalynne

customer_reviews.title: Not made for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful that this neck support would assist with comfort for air travel. I’m an average sized woman and this support must of been built for giants. It doesn’t hold well to your body unless you damn near strangle yourself with the scarf portion. And when you really fall asleep, it slides right off the shoulder before it bends. Extremely unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Ak

customer_reviews.title: Just great design with well balanced comforts and not bulky to pack.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this travel device. I have always been uncomfortable with the classic horseshoe neck pillows. Never support enough to keep your neck from getting a kink and they slide off. Both problems solved. Took this to Hawaii last week. HAD to get sleep on the way back as I had to go straight to work. WOW! Worked like a charm: Stays secure where you position it. Is soft fabric that was very comfortable. Kept my spine in great position and no neck kinks. Completely washable. Very small size to carry Got great sleep for an airplane ride.
customer_reviews.author: David L Cantwell

customer_reviews.title: Good for aching necks
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to try this as it claimed much but seemed overpriced. I only wanted something like this for just normal sleeping with my often aching neck. I've used other neck pillows which all helped somewhat. So I purchased this one hoping for better results. Thankfully it did—not a total cure but the best results yet in the morning after a good night's sleep. With the pillow I received there is also a sticker to claim another free pillow for an honest review. I haven't seen that mentioned here before. Anyway that clinched my rating here, and I trust that's not a subtle persuasion to unduly inflate any other reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: EZd

customer_reviews.title: I am a terrible flyer who recently took the red-eye from Dubai to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a terrible flyer who recently took the red-eye from Dubai to Chicago ( 15h). The Trt Pillow was a mini lifesaver! I was able to comfortably rest my head on the support and felt warm enough to actually doze off....a rare accomplishment for this skittish flyer. The velcro works wonderfully with regards to adjustment, and I liked wrapping the fabric around my mouth and nose. Sort of felt cosy ...even if I did look like a ninja in a neck brace! Overall, this product has changed the way that I fly, and I am so thankful for this invention and the opportunity to support a small company with big ideas.
customer_reviews.author: S.Viruly

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable and hot!
customer_reviews.text: I don't see the point of this pillow. It doesn't work any better than my blow-up crescent pillow, which works perfectly. If you wrap it tightly enough to actually hold your head up as they show in the photos, it's not smoothly spread out as it is in the photos. It's tightly wrapped around your neck, which is very constricting and hot as well, since it's made of fleece. Feels like you're choking to get it tight enough to hold your head up. If I want to sleep with my head on the side, I just use my blow-up crescent on the side. No need for this.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas reader

customer_reviews.title: Best travel gear ever
customer_reviews.text: We had a horrible time trying to get to Oreland from Alaska. We're sure that having this Trtl pillow was the only thing keeping us from falling over with exhaustion. Best money I have ever spent on a travel accessory. I'm planning to buy one for everyone in the family.
customer_reviews.author: WaywardOctopus

customer_reviews.title: Gets a little warm, but still worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, but if you are on a warm flight it definitely gets hot. We had an overnight flight on Air France and for some reason it was so hot on that plane so we couldn’t use it, but on the way back home it was the normal temperature and it worked very well. I would I still suggest buying it, it’s effective at keeping your head supported and it doesn’t take up much room in your bag. Maybe they could use a material that is more breathable. Still worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The material cover was nice and soft, but I found it overall to be awkward to use and carry. From the video and pictures, I didn't realize its actually a stiff plastic frame with a soft cover over it. You need to position to one side, and repeatedly reposition it often or else you get a neck ache from having your neck in one position too long. Did not work for me; returned it. I'll stick with my inflatable travel pillow (inflates to just how I need it, then deflates and stores easily in my carry on).
customer_reviews.author: RosaBlu

customer_reviews.title: Tilting and waking
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this. Easy to pack. Used on flight to Paris and back and also to San Francisco round trip. My head still flopped over too much. I tried several adjustments and I tried to use it under my cheek and chin on either side (firm support at that area). It was not comfortable and I kept waking. When I went on a long drive I brought my old travel neck pillow that is larger but cushy and offers better support. I am 5'7" and have a long narrow neck. I might still take it for reduced space when packing but support it with a rolled sweater or jacket.
customer_reviews.author: RicaCostaRica

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The promise of this product is that it will work better than one of those U-shaped pillows on long trips. I beg to differ. This was the most expensive regret I’ve made in a long time. We purchased 3 of these pillows for our trans-Atlantic flight, and they were beyond useless. In fact, unlike the inflatable pillows, these were large and constantly in the way. They were uncomfortable and didn’t work as promised. In fact, they didn’t work at all. If I weren’t overseas now, I’d return all 3. I hate them. Don’t buy. They’re useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Tmouh

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed - Didn't provide any neck support.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were excited to get these pillows for our trip around the world after reading so many positive reviews. Sure there were a few negative ones, but we purchased them anyway. What a mistake! After just a few flights we realized that these pillows do not work for either one of us. We ended up throwing them away. They didn't provide any support at all. Real bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason90025

customer_reviews.title: ... reading many reviews on amazon thinking it was a great idea for me and my partner
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 after reading many reviews on amazon thinking it was a great idea for me and my partner, it pillow was extremely comfortable on our 5 hours flight to Iceland, I've used it once during the whole trip as well as my partner. It was way too long for support, and very uncomfortable to sleep in. One of the pillow still has the plastic cover on it as we decided it caused more trouble on my neck after one use. Now we're back in the states and our return date expired and we are not able to find info for the seller to attempt returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tango A

customer_reviews.title: I hate how neck pillows push your head forward so this ...
customer_reviews.text: It was very helpful on a 10 hour flight recently. I hate how neck pillows push your head forward so this allowed me to rest my head in relative comfort. My airline seat had the "wings" that are supposed to hold your head in but I'm too short for them to work well. It looks weird on, but it does hold up your head. It's warm, but it's not so bad since flights tend to be cold. Would I take it on a short flight and intend to stay awake? No, but if I'm on a red eye or other coach/+ flight where I want to sleep, I'll pack it again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: I was able to sleep fairly comfortably and it kept my neck from flopping to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on my last flight. I was able to sleep fairly comfortably and it kept my neck from flopping to the side. i positioned it with the support at the front of my neck, so it also helped to keep my mouth closed while I slept. And, for those people who are always cold on airplanes, it is nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Pig_Weasley

customer_reviews.title: No neck support at all, so mediocre.
customer_reviews.text: I’m incredibly surprised this product has over 7000 largely positive reviews. I usually trust Amazon reviews, which is how I bought this product, but this product turned out less than mediocre, and it makes me question the top rating here. This product does nothing it claims. It’s a joke. I’ve tried it a myriad of ways and it offers almost zero neck support. The plastic bits in mine are correct and authentic, just flimsy as a free hanger from the dry cleaners. I like the concept but the end result didn’t measure up to more than a fleece scarf. I actually laughed while trying it out because of how miserable the support was. I’m sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goiburn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty bad for my neck I was seduced by the ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bad for my neck I was seduced by the positive reviews and the new concept but I tried it in the plane and couldn't sleep with that. It creates tension on the other side of my neck and doesn't really support anything. Still hoping to find the right neck pillow for me one day...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds my head up nicely and is comfortable, even if a bit warm.
customer_reviews.text: Holds my head up well. I have a serious problem with sleeping while moving.... planes, trains and automobiles... I find it pretty much impossible to fall asleep at all. With this I actually dozed for a bit on flights too/from NYC/London recently... so clearly they're doing something right. It is a bit on the warm side though, if they find a way to make it less so it would be pretty much perfect.... maybe some coolmax type fabric? Also, their customer service is top notch. I had a problem with the one that first arrived -- customer service contacted me and took care of it with great efficiency -- couldn't be happier with that experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kili

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this “pillow” for a transatlantic flight after doing loads of research. Other than keeping my neck cozy, it really wasn’t what I had hoped for. It offers a little bit of support so in conjunction w another pillow, it was find, but it doesn’t offer enough support to really hold your head in a comfortable position. I’d return it had I not used it already.
customer_reviews.author: 3KW1

customer_reviews.title: Spend some time wearing it before you travel to make sure it’s the right thing for you
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to love these. We bought them for a trip and both my husband and I were very uncomfortable using them and wished we brought our more bulky neck travel pillows. I am 5 ft tall and my husband 6ft tall. Neither is us could get comfortable with these. Plus when I used it for longer than an hour I experienced neck pain. I wish I could return but can’t because we passed our 30 day window.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: not just for juniors
customer_reviews.text: I first had the original trtl pillow but it didn't work for me { I'm 5"2 and my shoulders are too small as is my neck) I was waiting for the plus to come out but read the reviews and saw that it was still too big for some people , my last hope was the junior ! So I ordered it and was surprised how well it works for me , it's perfect for small people like me...
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Giving the pillow another try
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow for travel and trying to sleep on the plane since the traditional pillows just dont do it. This one is soft and has good support for your head. the only gripe i have is that i cant use my noise canceling headphones with it. Maybe ill figure out a way to use it but until then, earbuds will have to do if i am trying to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Alam

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a recent trip to Africa which included 43 hours of flight time. I have a horrible time sleeping on airplanes. Using the Trtl I was able to catch some sleep on all legs: approximately 3 hours on the 7+ hour flights and about 6-7 hours on the 13+ hour flights. This may not seem like a lot, but it was a lot more than I usually get. My neck was well-supported and comfortable. The only problem was on one flight where the cabin temperature was too hot and the guy next to me was wearing a fleece and man-spreading his elbow and upper arm into my seating area as he slept.
customer_reviews.author: IwaTat62

customer_reviews.title: great idea, needs better material.
customer_reviews.text: meh. i was super excited about this but the fabric is too flimsy. you have to pull the piece tight so that it stays in place but since the fabric is thin it just pulls to the center of your neck (not at all like the scarf look in the photos), and just feels strangle-y. to the company's credit when i told them about the issue they sent me the "new and improved" version, but it was exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: May be good for giraffes.
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable, unless you have a very long giraffe neck, I don't think this will work for you. It's almost impossible to try and get this in the right position, and I've tried doing it in front and both sides. The spring mechanism is somewhat stiff and doesn't compress very well and is awkward. Additionally, the fleece wrap is too warm even in the airplane. I bought two of them but will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: SM12

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with headphones of any kind.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be designed for people who either have long necks, or don’t use head phones of any kind. I’m a flight attendant and was attracted by the “pack ability” of this pillow, but after using it yesterday, I’m very disappointed. The only way to use this pillow and headphones is if you use it under your jaw; on your shoulder will push headphones off, or pinch ear buds. My noise canceling headphones are a must for me, so this product was a total waste... also, the fleece scrunches up and creates a noose around your neck.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Verboom

customer_reviews.title: JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of garbage. Do not buy it. I’m not sure where all of the positive reviews are coming from, but this item is not worth the cost. It’s super uncomfortable and actually made my neck hurt after testing it out for a few minutes. It seems that my neck was perhaps too short, or the product is poorly designed, because it kept pushing out away from my neck and offered no support. I could have wrapped the scarf tighter, but it was uncomfortably tight to the point where I could feel my pulse. Invest your money in a good travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey Smith

customer_reviews.title: Provides NO stability for the head/neck!
customer_reviews.text: This neck pillow is absolutely useless!! In order for the item to provide any stability for your neck, you have to fasten the neck component so tight that you nearly suffocate yourself, and even then, the item still fails to provide the support for your neck. I brought this with me on a 14 hour flight and it is the biggest regret I have. And since I specifically bought this item after all of the fake reviews before my long international trip, I cannot even return it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha K.

customer_reviews.title: Total joke
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take on a long flight overseas. It felt like I was in a C-collar. I couldn't wear it more than 30 minutes. It was so uncomfortable! I just came back from my trip and tried to return it but it says I missed the return window by one day. Awesome. So I just threw away $30. Stick with the typical airplane travel pillows...this one sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Druberri40

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: I used this pillow on a flight this week, it is awful. It is too high on the neck and caused me to have terrible neck pain while using it. I think it needs to be made in different sizes, not all necks are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Judy C

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for International flight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an international flight (11 hours) based on all the positive views. It was not comfortable, it didn't support my head and it wasn't what any of the things the positive viewers said. I'm so frustrated and wish I could return it. I have a long neck and thought it would be perfect. It did make me hot (which a few reviewers said). I tried to use it for lumbar support and it didn't hold it's shape. I'm 5'6 and 135lbs.
customer_reviews.author: T. Baker

customer_reviews.title: My neck has never been so sore
customer_reviews.text: This product has a bit of a learning curve. I bought a set of two for my husband and myself fir a Houston to Maui trip. At first it was okay but I felt it was too large for my petite frame. By the final leg of our flight my neck was so sore I could barely turn my head. I’m now writing this well over 24 hours after my final flight and my neck and shoulders are so stiff and sore I feel I need to see a chiropractor. My husband is okay but he definitely didn’t find this to be as comfortable as everyone says.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Muroff

customer_reviews.title: I think I mostly like it. When it arrived I thought
customer_reviews.text: I think I mostly like it. When it arrived I thought, "what a waste of money." Then I figured out how to wrap it and put it on and sat down to watch television. I promptly fell asleep and found it supported my head nicely. I then used it for two cross country trips and it actually worked. I'm a bit of a skeptic. It packs easily and I will use it again. I would certainly rank it higher than a foam collar or those large triangular things. I am on the short side, 5'4", and normal weight.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy plastic stump
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product due to all the stellar reviews but honestly after trying it on several trips it’s not all it’s cracked up to be. The support is minimal. I feel like I’m about to snap the thing. My head is too bent because there isn’t enough support from the plastic material. I have never fallen asleep with this one because I can’t ever get comfortable. Additionally because of the design the fabric gets very dirty and dusty. Unfortunately you can’t throw it into the wash because you’ll damage the plastic structure. TL:DR save your money and keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: What a great invention
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure about this device vs the standard neck pillow we’ve all seen in the plane that everyone lugs around attached their bag Well I have to say this device once I adjusted to my neck was super comfy and soft to rest my head chin on The position was much better than the other neck pillow as it was a taller profile not making your neck having to crane over to rest in the other pilllow See my picture of me caught napping with it and waking up without a neck ache It is also compact enough to stiff into any travel bag also
customer_reviews.author: Pharmer D

customer_reviews.title: Better to just buy a regular travel pillow.
customer_reviews.text: Has support. Still ended up using a regular travel pillow instead. The wrap could be more breathable but it feels like I’m being suffocated. Wish the material was a wicking material and didn’t contain the sweat. Was a bit disappointed because all my friends said they liked and based on so many reviews it looked as though it’d be a good product to try. I just think the engineers didn’t thoroughly think through the comfort levels this product could have a achieved. It’s a good beta but definitely not for me.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Really great travel addition, hopefully new improved versions will be developed soon!
customer_reviews.text: The shape makes it a bit funny to stick in your bag, but still takes up less room than the traditional airplane pillow. What I love is that you can take off the fabric (which is really soft but does get quite warm - can be good or bad) and wash it, which is a really nice feeling after being at the airport/airplane. I was able to sleep for 6 hours straight with this thing and my eyemask, which i've never been able to do before. I do wish there was a way to make it a bit sturdier, because sometimes I needed a bit more reinforcement to keep my head up.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get this, but after a few flights and bus rides I have concluded that it does not work for me. I really like how it wrapped around so as to keep my jaw from opening. The problem I have is that the structure is too flexible and my neck can bend too far to the side. I've tried tightening it, but there is still too much flexibility. If you have trouble sleeping upright this might not be helpful enough. But the material is very soft and might provide some relaxation if nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Niccie

customer_reviews.title: A must must buy
customer_reviews.text: The Trtl pillow was AWESOME! I don't write a lot of reviews, but when I do that means it must be something special. I just recently (literally hours ago before writing this) was on a plane from IAD to LAX - nonstop, this product worked like a charm! I slept through maybe about 90% of the flight before I finally woke up with no neck issues and feeling like I really got some good sleep. Even my wife said I looked peaceful! Oh, I forgot to mention, I was sitting in the MIDDLE SEAT! For the worldwide or domestic traveller, this is a must must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Not that effective
customer_reviews.text: I could never get this comfortably attached and working. Also, the velcro strip is too weak and not long enough to hold in the position I needed. If I made it too loose, it didn't support my neck. If it was snugger, it was too tight on my face and/or neck. The plastic support was too long and not the right shape for me, and I have a longish neck (which is why U-shaped pillows do nothing for me.) It was probably better than nothing, but not by much. I used it on two round-trip transatlantic flights. I found myself moving, twisting and adjusting it the whole flight.
customer_reviews.author: Merri-Lilac

customer_reviews.title: Compact design supports the neck but gets hot
customer_reviews.text: This neck pillow does support your neck for sleeping while sitting. You do need to adjust it so it supports you correctly. I had to adjust it so my head didn't fall forward, which wasn't as comfortable as having it on my shoulder. I used it while we were driving across country and it allowed me to nap. I'm a plus size woman and this still fit my neck. I like the compact size. It was easy to stow when I wasn't using it. It also works well on airplanes. The one downside is that the neck wrap is HOT. When the sun was on my side of the car, I got uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: LS in PDX

customer_reviews.title: Fake reviews!?
customer_reviews.text: Have no idea why this pillows have so many good reviews but both of our Kids 6 & 7 as well as me and my wife did not like this pillow at all. We used them on our international trip to Switzerland (12 hour flight) and our neck hurt more then with other cheaper pillows. It also gehts pretty warm while wearing it. It’s Stange how this pillow will stretch your neck in one way or an other and cases a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: One size does not fit all
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a coast-to-coast trip and it was the most uncomfortable thing I've ever used. The moment I wrapped it around my neck, it was already uncomfortable. It seems to be made for someone with a longer neck. The plastic support is rigid and inflexible. If you're a tall person with a long neck, it might work for you. Otherwise, steer clear of this one. The same company now makes one that is adjustable, but also more expensive. That might be a better option than this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mijares

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s easy to carry around - slips into the top of a carry on bag pretty easily. It’s very soft. It doesn’t quite give enough support to prevent me from getting a crick in my neck though. It prevents my head from bobbing around when I have nothing, but it doesn’t provide quite enough support to keep my neck from hurting. The distance from my head to my shoulder feels less than ideal for this product to work like it’s intended.
customer_reviews.author: Humperdink

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money (and space in the carry-on)
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money (and space in the carry-on)!!! Following the directs exactly, you either bury your mouth and nose or strain the side of your neck. I can't believe the good reviews on this product... I'm doing everything right and it is still ugly, bulky, and I dare you to get some kind of sleep with this product no matter where you sit on a plane. The woman in front of me had one as well and she had more difficulty with it then I did and never used it the whole overnight flight.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Not for me. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This may work for some, but not for me. First off, the quality is poor. I tried it out a few times to find out how to wear it comfortably and the stitching started to come undone before I was even able to use out for traveling. Secondly, it was difficult for me to find a comfortable position to use this brace. I also could not use it with headphones, only Ear buds. To put it on comfortably your elbows will intrude on the passengers next to you. The Velcro is very loud if you are trying to adjust or remove during a quiet red eye flight.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

It is well-cushioned all around the frame and it doesn't hurt when it presses on pressure points. I'm pleasantly surprised how cooling it is. I normally get hot very easily, but this is a really nice fleece that allows great airflow. I didn't get sweaty even after wearing this and sleeping for 2 hours straight. I'll never travel without it again.
